text: Celso Santiago de Souza, known as Zinho (born 5 July 1962) is a Brazilian football coach and a former player. He played 8 seasons and 178 games in the Primeira Liga for Braga, Sporting, Sporting Espinho and Penafiel. ==Club career== He made his Primeira Liga debut for Braga on 17 April 1983 as a late substitute in a 1–3 loss to Boavista. He scored three goals for Sporting in their first-round 1986–87 UEFA Cup matchup against ÍA. ==References== ==External links== Category:1962 births Category:Sportspeople from Rio de Janeiro (city) Category:Living people Category:Brazilian footballers Category:CR Vasco da Gama players Category:S.C.
